FuncDef:
The virtual-access enable command configures an existing IS-IS process as a virtual access IS-IS process.
The undo virtual-access enable command restores the virtual access IS-IS process to a common IS-IS process.
By default, no IS-IS process is configured as a virtual access IS-IS process.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Virtual access uses extended IS-IS to collect network topology information. A virtual access IS-IS process can be automatically or manually established.
Manual establishment: To plan IS-IS processes, perform the following operations:Run the isis command to create an IS-IS process.Run the virtual-access enable command to configure the process as a virtual access IS-IS process.
Automatic establishment: After you globally enable virtual access on a device, the device checks whether a virtual access IS-IS process exists. If a virtual access IS-IS process exists, the device enables only virtual access.

Prerequisites
An IS-IS process has been created using the isis command.
